line_2: The Man suspects his Lady's crying

line_1: Not to be afraid of dying.
line_2: Ne'er may I be found complying;

line_1: Had been better far than dying
line_2: To have fallen, my country crying

line_1: Yet when I reflect on the Wounded and Dying,
line_2: In spight of my Courage it sets me a sighing.
While the nymph, his darts defying,

line_1: 'Twas to save Thee, Child, from dying,

line_2: Then at her Feet dejected lying,

line_1: With airs most languishing and dying;
line_2: And tries in vain to shoot me flying.
Paint her sons at distance flying:
Such Hurry, whilst the Spirit's flying,
